comments:
Currently the person installing the STEM source code must define the ant variables eclipse.home2 and eclipse.contrib so that the ant script update.xml in org.eclipse.ohf.stem.internal.data can be run.  

It would seem that there must be other ways to obtain this information without making the user define it.  

John
Yes, I don't like how this works right now.  Most of the ant file is ok except for how it gets it's path information.

Created an attachment (id=64375)
part of the fix for this bug

Apparently with 3.3 the update.xml script no longer needs to have the eclipse extension jars in the classpath.  So I have removed the references to eclipse.contrib from update.xml.  
It does still require eclipse.home2 and so far I have not found a way to fix that. But will keep trying.  

John

The patch doesn't work for me.  It can't find the EMF stuff.

update_geography_plugin_xml:

OK, I see the problem.  For some reason, EMF got installed in my main folder and BIRT and other stuff got installed in the eclipseextension folder.  Strange since I swear I did the Europa update all in one operation.   I will blow away my installation and redo it. 

Back to the drawing board.  I have seen mention of an ant/eclipse plugin that might help.  I was hoping to avoid requiring the installation of non official plugins but ...  Would needing a non official plugin be an IP problem?


John

I think a non-official plugin would be a long term problem.  This should be fixable.  We really need to be able to run update.xml and any other ant builds outside of Eclipse, or at least with Eclipse running "headless".  It might be better to require some environment variables to be set, or maybe we can automate the discovery of the location of the required jars. 

In general we need to spend fsome "quality time" on our build and test process so that it is completely automatic.  We're getting to that point with most of the system working.  The more automation, the easier it will be for others to get involved.

Created an attachment (id=67536)
change info messages so they do not show up as red text

This does not fix the need for eclipse.home2 and eclipse.contrib but it fixes the informational messages so they do not show up highlighted in red.  
They will now be be displayed as informational messages just like any of the rest of the informational messages.  Mush less annoying

Created an attachment (id=77487)
New update.xml  

This makes 2 changes to the ANT script

- if eclipse.home2 not set it defaults to system env variable ECLIPSE_HOME .
- If eclipse.contrib is not set, it will use the value of eclipse.home2.

With components like EMF part of EUROPA, there is little need to require the use of an eclipseextension.  The installation doc will be updated to reflect this.
